results.title: Full Circle (Oil)
results.creator_credit: W.M. Larkins Studio and Peter Sachs
results.brief_description: Shows the improved services and other benefits that oil brings to the backward territories. The financial and technical resources of foreign lands have tapped the liquid wealth hidden below the surface of the earth. In return a new prosperity and improved standard of living is being brought to the peoples of those formerly barren lands.

results.title: Full circle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merry Go-Round, Sex Education. - Part 3.”.
A film for eight to ten year old children which answers the question “How does the baby begin?”. An explanation of intercourse and fertilization is given, the former using drawn silhouette figures of a man and a woman, the latter through animated drawings of sperm fertilizing the egg. The second half of the programme is about parental care.

results.title: Full ahead
results.creator_credit: Chris Stewart, Pacific Films and Roger Mirams
results.brief_description: Shows the fleet of the Australian National Line at work, shipping distant raw materials to centres of secondary industry. Forty-four ships call at fifty-three ports, some being specially fitted to carry a particular bulk cargo, such as semi-trailers on the ‘Bass Trader’. Cargo carried includes ironstone from Yampi Sound, softwoods from Stanley, and raw sugar from Townsville. Practical training of the crew is carried out on board under the captain’s supervision.

results.title: Fuels and heat: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: Explains the funtion of carbon in fuels, the manufacture and storage of carbohydrates in plants, the origin of coal and oil, and the method employed by man to utilise them. Combustion, and molecular action as affect the relation of hear to temperature, and the operation of steam and internal combustion engines are demonstrated by animated diagrams.

results.title: Fuelling Up (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This program aims to teach young people that diet does not mean the complete denial of nice things to eat, but rather the controlled, planned intake of good quality food - the fuel necessary to power life. Rated: G

results.title: Fuel crisis
results.brief_description: The end of the petrol shortages and the promise of North Sea oil have led many people to believe that the crisis is over. The film shatters that illusion. Forecasts sizeable and increasing energy shortages for the 1980’s which could have traumatic political and economic effects on society

results.title: Frying methods
results.creator_credit: Film Workshop, Gas Council and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the following methods of frying foods: deep frying, shallow frying, dry frying and the frying of sweet dishes. Vegetables, fish, eggs, steak, bacon and port are some of the foods used in this film.

results.title: Fruits, vegetables and co-operation
results.brief_description: Bill shows his fellow-farmers, by means of films, how other farmers are benefiting by marketing their crops co-operatively. Jake, an ultra-conservative, offers many objections to this method, but he is finally won over to the idea of starting a local co-operative society on a small scale. Such crops as celery, lettuce, apples and citrus fruits are grown and marketed co-operatively with great success.

results.title: Fruit fly
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit and Norman A. Uren
results.brief_description: The Mediterranean fruit fly is a serious pest of the fruit industry in Western Australia. It infests so many different types of fruit that it keeps alive throughout the seasons. It is the larvae that do the damage. It is necessary to keep orchards absolutely clean. One dirty orchard can affect the whole district.
